evidence: Loads raw customer data from a CSV file. – This indicates the initial loading of raw data.
Removes duplicate records from the dataset. – This is a data cleaning step, which is part of preprocessing.
Creates a new feature 'price_per_unit' by dividing 'total_price' by 'quantity'. – This is the creation of a new feature from existing data.
Saves the processed data to a Parquet file. – This indicates the completion of the feature engineering step.
Loads the processed data from a Parquet file. – This indicates the start of the feature selection process.
Selects specific features and the label for the model. – This is the key step of feature selection.
Splits the data into training and testing sets. – This is part of preparing the data for modeling, often done after feature selection.
Loads the normalized training data from a Parquet file. – This indicates the start of the model training process.
Trains a RandomForestClassifier using the selected features and labels. – This is the core of the model training step.
Loads the trained model and scaler. – This indicates the start of the model evaluation process.
Loads the test data from a Parquet file. – This is part of preparing the data for evaluation.
Normalizes the test data using the previously saved scaler. – This is a preprocessing step specific to the evaluation phase.
Makes predictions on the test data. – This is the scoring part of the evaluation.
Calculates the accuracy of the model. – This is the evaluation metric calculation.
Saves the evaluation results to a text file. – This indicates the completion of the evaluation process.
